conversation.trainstation01: Charlie arrives in Tokyo, dead tired and jet-lagged. He can't read any signs and people are reluctant to talk to him so he starts questioning his resolve for this exchange trip. His teacher claimed that the Japanese study English as a compulsory subject but Charlie suspects he was deceived.

conversation.trainStation02: I have a feeling that the lady who sold me the train ticket did it out of mercy and to get rid of me because she didn't even take my money.

conversation.trainStation03: Charlie looks around, nervous. People stare at him because he's the only foreigner here. He isn't in a tourist destination after all.

conversation.trainStation04: Am I even in the right town? Isn't someone supposed to pick me up?

conversation.trainStation05: He tries talking to the people nearby and some of them answer something that might be English but he can't understand a word.

conversation.trainStation06: Damn, I should have taken that Japanese language preparatory course when they were offering it. All I know are a few generic phrases from anime I've watched.

conversation.trainStation07: Suddenly, Charlie gets startled by a cheerful female voice.

conversation.trainStation09: Is yahoo a common greeting here? I thought it's a search engine.

conversation.trainStation10: Konnichiwa, are you the person who is supposed to pick me up?

conversation.trainStation11: Yep, Hanako desu. Naisu to meet yuu.

conversation.trainStation12: At least she speaks English a bit. But what's with those clothes? Is she into that kind of fashion?

conversation.trainStation13: My house is quite far from the station, let's take a takushii.
